focus: AI Disruption Fears • US CPI Risk • Trump-Iran Deal Optimism

headlines: AI disruption fears trigger risk-off rout as Algorhythm Holdings (RIME) SemiCab platform enables 300-400% freight volume scaling without headcount increase
US CPI (Jan) looms as key test for Fed rate cut timeline after blowout NFP pushed first cut to July
Trump says US could reach Iran deal within a month, warns it will be 'very traumatic' for Iran if no agreement
Strong 30-year Treasury auction (2.1bps stop-through, largest since April 2025) lifts bonds amid flight-to-quality
marketFocus.riskSentiment: Risk-Off: AI disruption fears sparked broad equity selloff (-1.55% SPX, -2.04% NDX) as logistics/industrials/software/gaming/financials sectors slumped on RIME's AI freight scaling tool. Flight-to-quality lifted Treasuries (30yr auction stellar). Crude fell on risk-off + Iran deal optimism. US CPI (Jan) today is critical for Fed rate cut path.

USD.summary: Dollar choppy ahead of critical US CPI (Jan) release. Risk-off trade provided modest support as havens outperformed, but Dollar failed to sustain gains. Post-NFP repricing pushed first Fed cut to July (from June), but sustainability concerns linger (BLS revisions -862k, sector concentration). CPI today will determine if Fed stays on hold longer or if soft inflation reopens June cut window. Initial Jobless Claims 227k (exp. 222k) showed labor market remains subdued. DXY rangebound, awaiting CPI catalyst.
drivers: US CPI (Jan) today at 14:30 ZRH Time (critical for Fed path)
Post-NFP repricing: first cut July (prev. June)
Risk-off tone provided modest haven support
BLS revisions -862k raise NFP sustainability concerns
Initial Jobless Claims 227k vs exp. 222k (subdued labor market)

EUR.summary: Euro lacked conviction, trading rangebound near 1.19 as participants await US CPI catalyst. ECB officials continued calls for more EU debt (Nagel: new reality requires more EU debt, sees benefits of Euro-wide benchmark safe asset). ECB Wage Tracker rose to 2.388% (prev. 2.316%). German Wholesale Prices (Jan) M/M 0.9% vs exp. 0.1% (Y/Y 1.2%). Swiss CPI (Jan) in line (0.1% Y/Y). EUR/USD flow-driven, awaiting US CPI for direction.
drivers: ECB's Nagel: new reality requires more EU debt
ECB Wage Tracker 2.388% (prev. 2.316%)
German Wholesale Prices M/M 0.9% vs exp. 0.1%
Swiss CPI (Jan) 0.1% Y/Y (in line)
Awaiting US CPI for directional catalyst

GBP.summary: Sterling remains under pressure after weak GDP data. GDP M/M 0.1% (in line), but GDP Y/Y 0.7% vs exp. 1.1% (prev. 1.2%). Manufacturing Production M/M -0.5% vs exp. 0.0% (prev. 1.9%). Industrial Production M/M -0.9% vs exp. 0.0%. Business Investment Q/Q -2.7% vs exp. -0.5%. Data signals UK economic weakness persists despite political stabilization. ING expects Q1 rebound due to seasonal effects, but says March BoE cut becomes 'highly likely' if growth and labor softness persist. GBP/USD rangebound 1.3604-1.3666, awaiting US CPI.
drivers: UK GDP Y/Y 0.7% vs exp. 1.1% (disappointing)
UK Manufacturing Production M/M -0.5% (prev. 1.9%)
UK Business Investment Q/Q -2.7% vs exp. -0.5%
ING: March BoE cut 'highly likely' if weakness persists
Awaiting US CPI for broader direction

JPY.summary: Yen outperformed as risk-off trade and intervention speculation supported. USD/JPY fell to 152.35 from 153.75 after sharp reversal sparked intervention speculation (though unlikely: Japan on holiday, government not sitting, Trump's Iran optimism not JPY-favorable narrative). Top currency diplomat Mimura: watching markets with high sense of urgency, in contact with US authorities. Japan requested US Fed/NY Fed JPY rate check in January. BoJ's Tamura: inflation becoming sticky, will keep raising rates if outlook met, price goal may be achieved as early as spring. Mizuho's Koshimizu: BoJ could deliver up to 3 hikes in 2026, starting March or April. Markets price ~60% March hike, ~92% June, fully July.
drivers: Risk-off trade + intervention speculation (USD/JPY 153.75→152.35)
BoJ's Tamura: inflation sticky, may achieve price goal this spring
Mizuho: BoJ could hike 3 times in 2026 (March/April start)
Markets price 60% March hike, 92% June, 100% July
Mimura: watching markets with high sense of urgency

AUD.summary: Aussie consolidating after recent outperformance, caught between hawkish RBA rhetoric and risk-off headwinds. Governor Bullock: inflation at 3-point something unacceptable, may need further rate hikes if inflation becomes entrenched. Deputy Gov Hauser: economy not just 'dig it and ship it', many parts doing quite well. However, AI disruption fears weighed on risk sentiment, limiting AUD gains. Westpac Consumer Sentiment -2.6% (prev. -1.7%) remains a bearish data point. Copper bid higher on Indonesia nickel mine output cut (70%). AUD/USD rangebound, awaiting US CPI.
drivers: RBA's Bullock: inflation at 3-point something unacceptable
RBA's Hauser: many parts of economy doing quite well
Westpac Consumer Sentiment -2.6% (bearish data)
Risk-off tone limits gains despite hawkish RBA
Copper rally on Indonesia nickel mine output cut

CAD.summary: Loonie remains under pressure as Trump USMCA exit risk lingers. Bloomberg reported Trump privately considering exiting North American trade pact, asking aides why he shouldn't withdraw. White House called it baseless speculation, but uncertainty persists. BoC Minutes: policy rate on stimulative side, need to maintain optionality. Crude prices firmer (WTI $62.84, Brent $67.52) but gains limited by risk-off trade and Trump-Iran deal optimism (Trump: could reach deal within a month). US Energy Secretary Wright: Venezuela will increase production 30-40% in first year, Russia/China/Iran influence will wane. USD/CAD choppy, awaiting US CPI.
drivers: Trump privately considering exiting USMCA (Bloomberg)
BoC Minutes: policy rate on stimulative side
Crude prices firmer but capped by risk-off + Iran deal optimism
Venezuela oil production to rise 30-40% (US Energy Secretary)
Awaiting US CPI for broader direction

CHF.summary: Franc outperformed as risk-off trade sparked safe-haven flows. AI disruption fears (Algorhythm Holdings SemiCab platform) triggered broad equity selloff, lifting CHF alongside JPY. Swiss CPI (Jan) in line (0.1% Y/Y, -0.1% M/M). SNB policy stable. EUR/CHF and USD/CHF rangebound as participants await US CPI. CHF benefited from flight-to-quality amid tech sector AI concerns (logistics, industrials, software, gaming, financials all slumped). Geopolitical tensions (Middle East, Russia-Ukraine) provided additional support.
drivers: Risk-off trade on AI disruption fears (safe-haven bid)
Swiss CPI (Jan) 0.1% Y/Y (in line, stable inflation)
Flight-to-quality amid tech sector selloff
Geopolitical tensions (Middle East, Russia-Ukraine)
Awaiting US CPI for broader direction

NZD.summary: Kiwi led G10 gains, supported by high-beta characteristics and RBNZ policy outlook. NZ 1yr Inflation Expectation (Q1) 2.6% (prev. 2.4%), 2yr 2.4% (prev. 2.6%) - mixed signals. RBNZ expected to hold OCR at 2.25% on Feb 18 after substantial easing since mid-2024. NZ Manufacturing PMI (Jan) 55.2 (prev. 56.1) - still solid expansion. Markets pricing potential rate increase later in 2026 as inflation expectations firm. Trump-Xi trade truce reportedly extended 1 year (April Beijing summit). NZD/USD resilient despite risk-off tone, awaiting US CPI.
drivers: NZ 1yr Inflation Expectation 2.6% (prev. 2.4%)
RBNZ expected to hold OCR at 2.25% on Feb 18
NZ Manufacturing PMI 55.2 (solid expansion continues)
Markets pricing potential rate increase later in 2026
Trump-Xi trade truce extended 1 year (April summit)

bonds.name: FGBL
bonds.summary: Bunds rallied amid risk-off trade and flight-to-quality flows. AI disruption fears sparked broad equity selloff, lifting safe-haven bonds. Bunds hit YTD highs above 129.00. German Chancellor Merz pushed back on joint European debt issuance (no eurobonds support). German Wholesale Prices (Jan) M/M 0.9% vs exp. 0.1% (inflationary pressure). ECB's Kazaks: ECB has yet to see full impact of EUR appreciation, worries strong EUR reflects dollar weakness, now not time to move rates. Bank of America lifts Germany 10yr yield target to 3% citing stronger growth. Bunds supported by USD weakness and stable ECB policy.
drivers: Risk-off trade on AI disruption fears (flight-to-quality)
German Chancellor Merz: no eurobonds support
ECB's Kazaks: now not time to move rates
BofA lifts Germany 10yr yield target to 3%
USD weakness supports EUR-denominated assets
Awaiting US CPI for broader direction

bonds.name: ZN
bonds.summary: T-Notes surged amid risk-off rout and stellar 30-year auction. AI disruption fears (Algorhythm Holdings SemiCab platform) triggered equity selloff, sparking flight-to-quality into Treasuries. 30yr auction stopped through by 2.1bps (largest since April 2025), bid-to-cover 2.66x (prev. 2.36x), indirect demand 69.9% (prev. 65.4%). Curve bull flattened led by long-end. 10yr yield -7.7bps to 4.106%, 30yr -8.3bps to 4.731%. US CPI (Jan) today is critical: soft CPI could reopen June Fed cut window, hot CPI cements July. Initial Jobless Claims 227k (exp. 222k) showed subdued labor market.
drivers: Risk-off trade on AI disruption fears (flight-to-quality)
Stellar 30yr auction (2.1bps stop-through, B/C 2.66x)
Curve bull flattened (10yr -7.7bps, 30yr -8.3bps)
US CPI (Jan) today critical for Fed rate cut path
Subdued labor market (Initial Claims 227k vs exp. 222k)
Fed's Miran: may be underestimating how restrictive policy is
